intro: Aethionema ertughrulii, commonly known as the Ertugrul's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, arid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
